availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William C. Barker (Estill County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Estill County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sally Ann Gum Barker in Estill County, Kentucky, on April 7, 1831. Father of Angeline Barker, Abram Barker, Susannah Barker, William Barker, Margaret A. Barker, Emmaline F. Barker, John C. Barker, and Taylor H. Barker. Farmer in Estill County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Estill county in 1850. Resident in Estill County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Estill County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 95A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 398B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, Station Camp, p. 601B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Estill County Marriages, Film #000254628, p. 66.
